intro: Adinandra lamponga, commonly known as the red-fruited tree, is a tropical plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Indonesia and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and produces small, fragrant flowers. Its most distinctive feature is the bright red, fleshy berries that mature in clusters. The berries are not only ornamental but also have traditional uses in local communities.
